member.name: T:Hnsw.CosineDistance
member.summary: Calculates cosine distance between vectors. Thread-safe implementation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.CosineDistance.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the distance function.

member.name: M:Hnsw.CosineDistance.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Calculates the cosine distance between two vectors. Returns 0 for identical vectors and approaches 2 for opposite vectors.
member.param: First vector. Cannot be null.
Second vector. Cannot be null.
member.returns: The cosine distance between the vectors (1 - cosine similarity).
member.exception: Thrown when a or b is null.
Thrown when vectors have different dimensions.

member.name: T:Hnsw.DotProductDistance
member.summary: Calculates dot product distance between vectors (negated for use as distance metric). Thread-safe implementation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.DotProductDistance.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the distance function.

member.name: M:Hnsw.DotProductDistance.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Calculates the negative dot product between two vectors. Higher dot product results in lower distance (negated).
member.param: First vector. Cannot be null.
Second vector. Cannot be null.
member.returns: The negative dot product between the vectors.
member.exception: Thrown when a or b is null.
Thrown when vectors have different dimensions.

member.name: T:Hnsw.EuclideanDistance
member.summary: Calculates Euclidean distance between vectors. Thread-safe implementation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.EuclideanDistance.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the distance function.

member.name: M:Hnsw.EuclideanDistance.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Calculates the Euclidean distance between two vectors.
member.param: First vector. Cannot be null.
Second vector. Cannot be null.
member.returns: The Euclidean distance between the vectors.
member.exception: Thrown when a or b is null.
Thrown when vectors have different dimensions.

member.name: T:Hnsw.HnswParameters
member.summary: Parameters for HNSW index configuration.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.M
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections per layer (except layer 0). Minimum: 2, Maximum: 100, Default: 16. Typical values range from 8 to 48.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.MaxM
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections for layer 0. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 200, Default: 32. Should be greater than M, typically 2*M.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.EfConstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the dynamic candidate list. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 2000, Default: 200. Higher values improve recall but decrease construction speed.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.MaxLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of layers in the graph. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 64, Default: 16. Typically between 10 and 30.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.LevelMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the level assignment multiplier. Minimum: Greater than 0, Maximum: 2.0, Default: 1/ln(2) ≈ 1.44. Controls the layer assignment probability distribution. Must be a finite number (not NaN or Infinity).

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.ExtendCandidates
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to extend candidates with neighbors' neighbors. Default: false. Can improve recall at the cost of construction time.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.KeepPrunedConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to add pruned connections to lower levels. Default: false. Can improve connectivity at the cost of more memory usage.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswParameters.DistanceFunctionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the distance function. Minimum length: 1 (non-whitespace), Maximum length: 100 characters, Default: "L2". Common values: "L2", "L1", "Cosine", "InnerProduct". Cannot be null or whitespace.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswParameters.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HnswParameters class with default values.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswParameters.Validate
member.summary: Validates that all parameters are consistent with each other.

member.name: T:Hnsw.HnswIndex
member.summary: Main HNSW (Hierarchical Navigable Small World) index implementation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.DistanceFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance function used for vector comparisons. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new EuclideanDistance instance. Default: EuclideanDistance.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.M
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections per layer (except layer 0). Minimum: 2, Maximum: 100, Default: 16. Typical values range from 8 to 48.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.MaxM
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of connections for layer 0. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 200, Default: 32. Should be greater than or equal to M, typically 2*M.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.EfConstruction
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the dynamic candidate list. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 2000, Default: 200. Higher values improve recall but decrease construction speed.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.MaxLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of layers in the graph. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 64, Default: 16. Typically between 10 and 30.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.LevelMultiplier
member.summary: Gets or sets the level assignment multiplier. Minimum: Greater than 0, Maximum: 2.0, Default: 1/ln(2) ≈ 1.44. Controls the layer assignment probability distribution. Must be a finite number (not NaN or Infinity).

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.ExtendCandidates
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to extend candidates with neighbors' neighbors. Default: false. Can improve recall at the cost of construction time.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.KeepPrunedConnections
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to add pruned connections to lower levels. Default: false. Can improve connectivity at the cost of more memory usage.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.Seed
member.summary: Gets or sets the _Random seed for reproducible results. Minimum: -1 (_Random seed), Maximum: int.MaxValue, Default: -1. Use -1 for _Random seed, or any non-negative value for deterministic behavior.

member.name: P:Hnsw.HnswIndex.VectorDimension
member.summary: Gets the vector dimension for this index.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.#ctor(System.Int32,Hnsw.IHnswStorage,Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HNSWIndex class with custom _Storage.
member.param: The dimensionality of vectors to be indexed. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 4096.
Storage backend implementation. Cannot be null.
Layer _Storage backend implementation. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.#ctor(System.Int32,Hnsw.IHnswStorage,Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HNSWIndex class with custom _Storage and seed.
member.param: The dimensionality of vectors to be indexed. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 4096.
Storage backend implementation. Cannot be null.
Layer _Storage backend implementation. Cannot be null.
Random seed for reproducible results. Use null for _Random seed.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.AddAsync(System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds a vector to the index.
member.param: Unique identifier for the vector.
Vector data. Cannot be null. Must match index dimension.
Cancellation token.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.AddNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds multiple vectors to the index in a single atomic operation. Acquires write lock once, updates _Storage and graph structure, then releases lock. More efficient than calling AddAsync multiple times.
member.param: Dictionary mapping node IDs to their vector data. Cannot be null or empty.
Cancellation token.
member.exception: Thrown when nodes is null.
Thrown when nodes is empty, any ID is Guid.Empty, or vector dimensions don't match.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.RemoveAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes a vector from the index.
member.param: Identifier of the vector to remove.
Cancellation token.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.RemoveNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Guid},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes multiple vectors from the index in a single atomic operation. Acquires write lock once, updates _Storage and graph structure, then releases lock. More efficient than calling RemoveAsync multiple times.
member.param: List of node IDs to remove. Cannot be null or empty.
Cancellation token.
member.exception: Thrown when nodeIds is null.
Thrown when nodeIds is empty.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.GetTopKAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Finds the k nearest neighbors to a query vector.
member.param: Query vector. Cannot be null. Must match index dimension.
Number of neighbors to return. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 10000.
Optional search parameter. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 10000. Default: max(EfConstruction, count*2).
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Collection of nearest neighbors with distances.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.ExportStateAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Exports the current state of the index.
member.param: Cancellation token.
member.returns: Serializable state of the index. Never null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.HnswIndex.ImportStateAsync(Hsnw.HnswState,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Imports a previously exported state into the index.
member.param: State to import. Cannot be null. Vector dimension must match index dimension.
Cancellation token.

member.name: T:Hnsw.IDistanceFunction
member.summary: Interface for distance calculation between vectors.

member.name: P:Hnsw.IDistanceFunction.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the distance function.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IDistanceFunction.Distance(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Calculates the distance between two vectors.
member.param: First vector. Cannot be null.
Second vector. Cannot be null.
member.returns: Distance between the vectors.
member.exception: Thrown when a or b is null.
Thrown when vectors have different dimensions.

member.name: T:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage
member.summary: Interface for storing and retrieving HNSW node layer assignments. Implementations can use in-memory storage, database storage, or other persistence mechanisms.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.GetNodeLayer(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the layer assignment for a specific node. Thread-safe operation.
member.param: Node identifier.
member.returns: The layer number for the node, or 0 if not found.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.SetNodeLayer(System.Guid,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the layer assignment for a specific node. Thread-safe operation.
member.param: Node identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty.
Layer number. Minimum: 0, Maximum: 63.
member.exception: Thrown when nodeId is Guid.Empty.
Thrown when layer is outside valid range.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.RemoveNodeLayer(System.Guid)
member.summary: Removes the layer assignment for a specific node. Thread-safe operation. No effect if the node doesn't exist.
member.param: Node identifier.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.GetAllNodeLayers
member.summary: Gets all node layer assignments. Thread-safe operation. Returns a copy to prevent external modification.
member.returns: Dictionary mapping node IDs to layer numbers.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.Clear
member.summary: Removes all layer assignments. Thread-safe operation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.IHnswLayerStorage.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes with layer assignments. Thread-safe operation.
member.returns: The count of nodes with layer assignments.

member.name: T:Hnsw.IHnswNode
member.summary: Interface for HNSW graph nodes.

member.name: P:Hnsw.IHnswNode.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the node.

member.name: P:Hnsw.IHnswNode.Vector
member.summary: Gets the vector associated with the node.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswNode.GetNeighbors
member.summary: Gets a copy of the node's neighbors organized by layer.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswNode.AddNeighbor(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a neighbor connection at the specified layer.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswNode.RemoveNeighbor(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Removes a neighbor connection at the specified layer.

member.name: T:Hnsw.IHnswStorage
member.summary: Interface for HNSW storage backend.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.AddNodeAsync(System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds a new node to storage.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.AddNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Adds multiple nodes to storage in a batch operation. More efficient than calling AddNodeAsync multiple times.
member.param: Dictionary mapping node IDs to their vector data. Cannot be null.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.RemoveNodeAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes a node from storage.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.RemoveNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Removes multiple nodes from storage in a batch operation. More efficient than calling RemoveNodeAsync multiple times.
member.param: Collection of node IDs to remove. Cannot be null.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Task representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.GetNodeAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a node by ID.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.GetNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets multiple nodes by their IDs in a batch operation. More efficient than calling GetNodeAsync multiple times.
member.param: Collection of node IDs to retrieve. Cannot be null.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Dictionary mapping node IDs to their corresponding nodes. Only includes nodes that exist.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.TryGetNodeAsync(System.Guid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Tries to get a node by ID.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.GetAllNodeIdsAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets all node IDs in storage.

member.name: M:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.GetCountAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes in storage.

member.name: P:Hnsw.IHnswStorage.EntryPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry point node ID.

member.name: T:Hnsw.MinHeap`1
member.summary: Simple min-heap implementation for priority queue operations.
member.typeparam: The type of elements in the heap.

member.name: P:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the heap. Minimum: 0, Maximum: int.MaxValue (limited by available memory).

member.name: P:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets whether the heap is empty.

member.name: P:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the capacity of the internal storage. Minimum: 0, Maximum: int.MaxValue (limited by available memory). Setting a smaller capacity than Count will automatically adjust to Count.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MinHeap class with default capacity.
member.param: Optional comparer for items with equal priority. If null, uses Comparer<T>.Default.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MinHeap class with specified initial capacity.
member.param: Initial capacity. Minimum: 0, Maximum: int.MaxValue.
Optional comparer for items with equal priority. If null, uses Comparer<T>.Default.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Push(System.Single,`0)
member.summary: Adds an item to the heap with the specified priority. Lower priority values are considered higher priority (min-heap).
member.param: The priority of the item. Must be a finite number (not NaN or Infinity).
The item to add. Can be null if T is a reference type.
member.exception: Thrown when priority is NaN or Infinity.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Pop
member.summary: Removes and returns the item with the lowest priority.
member.returns: A tuple containing the priority and item.
member.exception: Thrown when the heap is empty.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Peek
member.summary: Returns the item with the lowest priority without removing it.
member.returns: A tuple containing the priority and item.
member.exception: Thrown when the heap is empty.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the heap.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines whether the heap contains a specific item.
member.param: The item to locate in the heap.
member.returns: true if item is found in the heap; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.GetAll
member.summary: Returns all items in the heap sorted by priority (ascending). Items with equal priority are sorted using the item comparer. This operation does not modify the heap.
member.returns: A new list containing all items sorted by priority.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.GetAllUnsorted
member.summary: Returns all items in the heap in their internal storage order (not sorted). This operation is O(n) and does not modify the heap.
member.returns: A new list containing all items in heap order.

member.name: M:Hnsw.MinHeap`1.ToArray
member.summary: Converts the heap to an array sorted by priority (ascending).
member.returns: An array containing all items sorted by priority.

member.name: T:Hnsw.NodeState
member.summary: Represents the state of a node for serialization. Used for exporting and importing HNSW index state.

member.name: P:Hnsw.NodeState.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the node identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty. Default: Guid.Empty (should be set to valid value before use).

member.name: P:Hnsw.NodeState.Vector
member.summary: Gets or sets the vector data. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new empty list. Vector dimension typically ranges from 1 to 4096. All values should be finite (not NaN or Infinity). Default: Empty list.

member.name: P:Hnsw.NodeState.Layer
member.summary: Gets or sets the layer assignment. Minimum: 0, Maximum: 63, Default: 0. Represents the highest layer where this node appears in the HNSW graph.

member.name: P:Hnsw.NodeState.Neighbors
member.summary: Gets or sets the neighbor connections by layer. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new empty dictionary. Keys are layer numbers (0 to Layer), values are lists of neighbor IDs. Each layer can have different connection limits: - Layer 0: Up to MaxM connections (typically 32) - Other layers: Up to M connections (typically 16) Default: Empty dictionary.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeState class with default values.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeState class with specified ID and vector.
member.param: The node identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty.
The vector data. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single},System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Guid}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeState class with full specification.
member.param: The node identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty.
The vector data. Cannot be null.
The layer assignment. Minimum: 0, Maximum: 63.
The neighbor connections. Can be null (creates empty dictionary).

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the node state is consistent and ready for use.
member.exception: Thrown when validation fails.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.GetTotalNeighborCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of neighbors across all layers.
member.returns: The total neighbor count.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.GetNeighborsAtLayer(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the neighbors at a specific layer.
member.param: The layer number. Minimum: 0, Maximum: 63.
member.returns: A list of neighbor IDs at the specified layer, or empty list if layer has no neighbors.

member.name: M:Hnsw.NodeState.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this NodeState.
member.returns: A new NodeState instance with copied values.

member.name: T:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1
member.summary: Represents an item with an associated priority for use in priority queues.

member.summary: Gets the priority of the item. Lower values indicate higher priority.

member.name: P:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1.Item
member.summary: Gets the item associated with the priority.

member.name: M:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1.#ctor(System.Single,`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PriorityItem class.
member.param: The priority of the item. Must be a finite number.
The item associated with the priority.
member.exception: Thrown when priority is NaN or Infinity.

member.name: M:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the priority item.
member.returns: A string containing the priority and item information.

member.name: M:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current priority item.
member.param: The object to compare with the current priority item.
member.returns: true if the specified object is equal to the current priority item; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Hnsw.PriorityItem`1.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this priority item.
member.returns: A hash code for the current priority item.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from the query vector.

member.summary: Gets or sets the node identifier.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchCandidate class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchCandidate class with specified values.

Node identifier.

member.summary: Compares this candidate to another based on distance.

member.returns: A value indicating the relative order.

member.name: T:Hnsw.SearchContext
member.summary: Search context that provides caching of nodes during search operations. This dramatically reduces the number of storage reads during search traversal.

member.name: P:Hnsw.SearchContext.CachedNodeCount
member.summary: Gets the number of nodes currently cached.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.#ctor(Hnsw.IHnswStorage,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SearchContext class.
member.param: The storage backend to read nodes from.
Cancellation token for the search operation.
member.exception: Thrown when storage is null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.GetNodeAsync(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets a node by ID, using the cache if available.
member.param: The node ID to retrieve.
member.returns: The requested node.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.GetNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Gets multiple nodes by their IDs, using cache where possible and batch-loading the rest.
member.param: Collection of node IDs to retrieve.
member.returns: Dictionary mapping node IDs to nodes.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.PrefetchNodesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Guid})
member.summary: Pre-fetches nodes into the cache to avoid individual loads later.
member.param: Collection of node IDs to pre-fetch.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.TryGetNodeAsync(System.Guid)
member.summary: Tries to get a node, returning success status.
member.param: The node ID to retrieve.
member.returns: Result indicating success and the node if found.

member.name: M:Hnsw.SearchContext.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the cache. Useful for long-running operations to control memory usage.

member.name: T:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a TryGetNode operation.

member.name: P:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.Success
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the node was found.

member.name: P:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.Node
member.summary: Gets or sets the node if found, null otherwise.

member.name: M:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TryGetNodeResult class.

member.name: M:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.#ctor(System.Boolean,Hnsw.IHnswNode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TryGetNodeResult class with specified values.
member.param: Whether the node was found.
The node if found. Can be null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.Found(Hnsw.IHnswNode)
member.summary: Creates a successful result with the specified node.
member.param: The found node. Cannot be null.
member.returns: A successful result.
member.exception: Thrown when node is null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.TryGetNodeResult.NotFound
member.summary: Creates a failed result indicating the node was not found.
member.returns: A failed result.

member.name: T:Hnsw.VectorResult
member.summary: Represents a search result containing the vector ID, distance, and vector data. Used to return results from nearest neighbor searches in the HNSW index.

member.name: P:Hnsw.VectorResult.GUID
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the vector. Cannot be Guid.Empty. Default: Guid.Empty (should be set to valid value before use).

member.name: P:Hnsw.VectorResult.Distance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from the query vector. Minimum: 0.0 (identical vectors), Maximum: float.MaxValue, Default: 0.0. Must be a finite non-negative number (not NaN or Infinity). Distance interpretation depends on the distance function used: - Euclidean: L2 distance (0 = identical) - Cosine: 1 - cosine similarity (0 = identical, 2 = opposite) - DotProduct: Negative dot product (lower = more similar)

member.name: P:Hnsw.VectorResult.Vectors
member.summary: Gets or sets the vector data. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new empty list. Vector dimension typically ranges from 1 to 4096. All values should be finite (not NaN or Infinity). Default: Empty list. Note: Property name 'Vectors' is plural for compatibility but represents a single vector.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VectorResult class with default values.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Single,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Single})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VectorResult class with specified values.
member.param: The vector identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty.
The distance from query. Minimum: 0.0.
The vector data. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.#ctor(System.Guid,System.Single,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Single})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the VectorResult class by copying vector data.
member.param: The vector identifier. Cannot be Guid.Empty.
The distance from query. Minimum: 0.0.
The vector data to copy. Cannot be null.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the result is complete and consistent.
member.exception: Thrown when validation fails.

member.name: P:Hnsw.VectorResult.Dimension
member.summary: Gets the dimension of the vector.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.Clone
member.summary: Creates a deep copy of this VectorResult.
member.returns: A new VectorResult instance with copied values.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the vector result.
member.returns: A string containing the GUID, distance, and vector dimension.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.Equals(Hnsw.VectorResult)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance is equal to another VectorResult.
member.param: The VectorResult to compare with.
member.returns: true if the instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance is equal to another object.
member.param: The object to compare with.
member.returns: true if the instances are equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Hnsw.VectorResult.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: T:Hsnw.HnswState
member.summary: Represents the complete state of an HNSW index.

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.VectorDimension
member.summary: Gets or sets the vector dimension. Minimum: 1, Maximum: 4096, Default: 128. Common values: 128, 256, 512, 768, 1024.

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the index parameters. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new instance with default values. Default: New HnswParameters instance with default values.

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.Nodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of nodes. Cannot be null. Setting to null creates a new empty list. Default: Empty list. Maximum recommended size: 100,000,000 nodes (depending on available memory).

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.EntryPointId
member.summary: Gets or sets the entry point node ID. Can be null when the index is empty. Default: null.

member.name: M:Hsnw.HnswState.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HnswState class with default values.

member.name: M:Hsnw.HnswState.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HnswState class with specified vector dimension.
member.param: The dimension of vectors to be indexed.

member.name: M:Hsnw.HnswState.Validate
member.summary: Validates that the state is consistent and ready for use.

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.NodeCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of nodes in the index.

member.name: P:Hsnw.HnswState.IsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if the index is empty (has no nodes).
